description: A Rust-native browser automation library inspired by Playwright. Provides high-level API for controlling Chromium browsers via Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP) with support for element locators, assertions, network interception, and test fixtures.
rules: Use `viewpoint-test` as the primary crate for testing. It re-exports `viewpoint-core` types.
Create a `TestHarness` for automatic browser setup/cleanup. Call `TestHarness::new().await?` to get started.
Use `page.goto(url).goto().await?` for navigation. The builder pattern allows configuring wait states.
Use `page.locator(selector)` to find elements. Locators auto-wait before performing actions.
Use `expect(locator).to_be_visible().await?` for assertions. All assertions auto-wait.
Use `page.route(pattern, handler)` for network interception and mocking.
The `js!` macro validates JavaScript at compile time. Use `#{expr}` for value interpolation.
Browser contexts are isolated (like incognito). Use `browser.new_context()` for isolation.
Actions like `click()` auto-wait for navigation. Use `.no_wait_after(true)` to opt out.
